segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so calm when there’s a flood happening?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, but she’s too busy to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and she won’t even see it coming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just a disaster in the making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at the woman to wake up and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and the floor is getting more dangerous by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone is going to get hurt, and it’s all so unnecessary.
segments.speaker: PAR
